summary: Email correspondence from an Assistant United States Attorney to a legal coordinator at Developmental & Forensic Pediatrics, P.A., inquiring about Dr. Cooper as a potential expert witness for the trial of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, scheduled for July 12, 2021. The email discusses scheduling a conference call.

persons.name: Dr. Cooper
persons.context: A doctor from Developmental & Forensic Pediatrics, P.A., whom federal prosecutors wish to speak with about potentially testifying at the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, which is scheduled for trial.

connections.description: Dr. Cooper is being considered as a potential expert witness for the prosecution in the trial against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Scheduled Trial Date for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The criminal trial of Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to begin on this date in the Southern District of New York.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Federal prosecutors are seeking Dr. Cooper as a potential expert witness for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.
The trial for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled for July 12, 2021.
The correspondence originates from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York.
The document is an email chain discussing the scheduling of a conference call with the expert witness.
